article.headline: St. Francis, NY 87, Robert Morris 79
article.story: CORAOPOLIS, Pa. -- Stefan Perunicic scored 28 points and Ricky Cadell had 19 to lead St. Francis, N.Y. to an 87-79 victory over Robert Morris in the Northeast Conference opener for both teams on Thursday. Kayode Ayeni added 14 points for St. Francis (2-4) and Jamaal Womack added 11. Jeremy Chappell had 22 points for Robert Morris (3-4) while Jimmy Langhurst and Mezie Nwigwe each had 11. The teams battled for the lead in the first half, which St. Francis finished with a 43-40 edge. Robert Morris took a brief one-point lead in the opening minutes of the second half and got within one point several times after that, but St. Francis maintained a narrow lead and stretched it to an 11-point advantage, 75-64, on a 3-pointer by Justin Newton with 3:11 remaining.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
